justification: The article discusses a scale designed to measure physiognomic beliefs, stating that 'The bounds of physiognomy: Lay beliefs in the manifestation of personality traits in faces' assesses general physiognomic beliefs.

Participants' trust decisions were observed in a trust game, and the article mentions that 'Reliance on facial trustworthiness' was one of the factors investigated, suggesting that facial trustworthiness was measured using this game.
The paper notes that 'candidates' perceived attractiveness' was regressed on photo ratings, indicating that facial attractiveness was measured via photo ratings.
The influence of facial trustworthiness on judgments is explicitly mentioned, indicating that subjective judgments based on facial appearance were used to assess trustworthiness.
